channel.title: SevenAtSevenSection1
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenSection1, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.description: A tribunal in Dhaka sentenced Sheikh Hasina to death for her involvement in the use of deadly force against protesters last year. She fled to India an...

item.title: Ecuador rejects U.S. military bases in major defeat for President Noboa

item.title: Why some ant colonies get tricked into killing their own queens
item.description: For some would-be ant queens, the easiest way to take over a colony is to dupe its worker ants into committing regicide.

item.title: More than 130 arrested in North Carolina as governor says immigration crackdown is ‘stoking fear’
item.description: U.S. immigration agents arrested more than 130 people in a weekend sweep through North Carolina’s largest city.

item.title: Luminar is fighting with its biggest customer as bankruptcy threat looms
item.description: The fight comes at a perilous time for Luminar, which is running out of cash and under SEC investigation.

item.title: Ramp hits $32B valuation, just 3 months after hitting $22.5B
item.description: In 2025 alone, Ramp has leapt from being worth $13 billion to $32 billion with new rounds every few months.

item.title: Cisco acquires translation startup EzDubs
item.description: Cisco has acquired Y Combinator-backed translation app EzDub to integrate it into its communication suite.

item.title: Ford turns to Amazon to give used cars sales a boost
item.description: Amazon Autos, which kicked off last year with Hyundai, initially started with new cars. The deal with Ford pushes it into used car territory.
